titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Harold H. Fisher Papers, 1917-1974
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 33 manuscript boxes, 44 card file boxes, 5 envelopes, 1 oversize box, l phonorecord

did.abstract: Clippings, printed matter, notes, correspondence, pamphlets, articles, microfilm, and photographs, relating to the Soviet Union, the San Francisco Conference organizing the United Nations, the Civil War in Spain, Herbert Hoover and the American Relief Administration, and the history of Finland.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Harold H. Fisher papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.corpname: United Nations Conference on International Organization (1945 : San Francisco, Calif.)
controlaccess.subject: International relief.
World War, 1914-1918.
World War, 1914-1918--Civilian relief.

chronitem.event: Captain of field artillery, U.S. Army
Assistant to Herbert Hoover with the American Relief Administration (A.R.A.); chief of history department of A.R.A.
Honorary doctorate of humane letters (L.H.D.), University of Vermont
Director, Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace; professor of history, Stanford University
Assistant to former governor Harold E. Stassen of U.S. Delegation to San Francisco Conference
Director, School of Naval Administration, Stanford University
Professor of international relations, San Francisco State College

Also: Author of numerous books on the Soviet Union; editorial writer for the Washington Herald; business editor of The New Republic; radio news analyst for CBS and NBC; active in Asian scholarship; former director of Belgian-American Educational Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Clippings, printed matter, notes, correspondence, pamphlets, articles, microfilm, and photographs, relating to the Soviet Union, the San Francisco Conference organizing the United Nations, the Civil War in Spain, Herbert Hoover and the American Relief Administration, and the history of Finland.
Newspaper clippings, magazines, printed matter, pamphlets, correspondence, manuscripts of books, notes, scripts for lectures and radio broadcasts, and bulletins, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Allen, Henry J., "Senator Allen Looks Into the Real Russia," clippings of a series of articles for the New York Evening Post, 1933
Armstrong, John A., "History of the C.P.S.U.," n.d. Mimeographed copy of a typewritten draft
Barnes, Joseph, clippings of articles on the Soviet Union for the New York Herald Tribune1939
Blumenthal, "The Soviet Union and The United Nations," n.d. Mimeographed copy of a typewritten draft
"Manchukuo--Japan's Imperialistic Venture," clippings of a series of 6 articles for the Christian Science Monitor1936
"Russia--without Benefit of Censor," clippings of a series of 18 articles for the Christian Science Monitor1934
Conference on the Transformation of Russian Society since 1861, April 25-27, 1958
Duranty, Walter and Harold Denny, clippings of articles on the Soviet Union, 1930-1940
Educational Committee to Halt Atomic Weapons Spread, 1966
Karelia, ca. 1921-1928 (information on Karelia enclosed in envelope addressed to Herbert Hoover from the Finnish Legation)
Typewritten and handwritten drafts, typewritten mimeographed copies
"Handelsrecht und Handels-Regulierung in der Sowjetunion (Business Rights and Government Influence in the Soviet Union)," 1928
"L'Avenir du Droit Civil dans l'Union Sovietique (Concerning Civil Rights in the Soviet Union)," 1937
"L'Etat sovietique et la Statut de ses Representations commerciales (The Soviet State and its Commercial Representation Statute)," 1934
"Zasada Domicylu W Nowym Lotewskim Prawie Miedzynarodowym," (The Right of Domicile in the New Latvian International Law)," 1938
Hoover (Herbert) and the American Relief Admnistration, 1925
House Committee on Un-American Activities. Contempt of Congress against Dr. Jeremiah Standler and Mrs. Yolanda Hall, 1966
Internationale Vereinigung fuer Rechts-und Wirtschaftsphilosophie (International Organization for Rights and Scientific Philosophy)
Kelly, Fred C., "Notes from a Russian Diary," clippings of a series of articles for the New York Herald Tribune1933.
Knickerbocker, H. R., "Fighting the Red Trade Menace," clippings of a series of 24 articles for the New York Evening Post1930-1931
Madison, Bernice, "Organization of Welfare Services in Pre- and Post-Revolutionary Russia, 1861-1957," n.d. Typewritten draft
Mason, John Brown, Research Resources; Annotated Guide to the Social Sciences, 1966. Mimeographed typewritten copy
Newman, Joseph, "Russia Uncensored," clippings of a series of articles for the New York Herald Tribune1949
Peace and Plenty - science and the post-war world, 1941-1942
"Peaceful Change in Modern Society," conference presented by the Hoover Institution on its 50th anniversary, 1969
Schapiro, Leonard, The Communist Party of the Soviet Union mimeographed copy of a typewritten draft of chapters 6-14, n.d.
School of Naval Administration, schedules and lists of guest speakers, 1946-1947
Seminar on Peace Settlement, Hoover Library, 1941
Communist Party of the Soviet Union (C.P.S.U.) Twentieth Congress of, 1956
Trotsky, Leon, Stalin: An Appraisal of the Man and His Influence, translated by Charles Malamuth, 1941. Typewritten carbon copy of changes made in galley copy.

scopecontent.p: Books and articles, arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: "The Beginning of the 'Third Period', 1928-1929," n.d. Typewritten draft, with typewritten carbon copies of appended documents
"The Character of American Participation in Euoropean Affairs since the War," 1926. Printed copy.
"History of Relief," 1926. Article prepared for the Encyclopaedia Britannica. Typewritten draft.

scopecontent.p: Card catalogs, microfilm and notes, arranged as listed.

did.unittitle: Partiinoe Stroitel'stvo - Zhurnal Tsentral'nogo Komiteta Vsesoiuznoi Kommunisticheskoi Partii (Party Structure - Journal of the Central Committee

scopecontent.p: Includes one record, photographs, and an album.

Headline Edition. Newscast. August 30, 1946. Council of Foreign Ministers. Paris Peace Conference. Interview with Dr. Harold Fisher, Director of the School of Naval Administration, Stanford, Calif. 1 disc

did.unittitle: 1 print of Harold H. Fisher with Army officers,
3 prints of paintings depicting the famine in Soviet Russia, plus 3 negatives,
1 framed print of Herbert C. and Lou Henry Hoover (autographed),
1 mounted print of a painting of Herbert C. Hoover (autographed),
5 prints of Harold H. Fisher and others; 2 prints of unidentified groups,

scopecontent.p: Biographical notes, relating mainly to persons figuring in the Russian Revolution, arranged alphabetically.
Index to persons mentioned in the Sochneniia of V. I. Lenin, arranged alphabetically.
Bibliographical references to topics mainly associated with the Russian Revolution, unarranged.
Biographical notes, relating mainly to persons figuring in the Russian Revolution, arranged alphabetically.
Notes relating to newspapers and other periodicals, mainly associated with the Russian Revolution, arranged alphabetically.
